p: In addition to the renaissance of strike activity, social movement unionism is growing. Unions, particularly in the public sector, are focusing on collaborative partnerships with other organizations and with the people they serve. Teachers’ strikes have focused on the quality of public education, seeking increased funding for schools with support of parents (Yan 2018). An organization supporting these partnerships is Bargaining for the Common Good, a coalition of community organizations and public sector unions that describes itself as follows: “Unions that have the right to bargain use contract fights as an opportunity to organize with community partners around a set of demands that benefit not just the bargaining unit, but also the wider community as a whole” (Bargaining for the Common Good, About Us 2020).
